page.title: 02MANOR HOUSE, MISKIN
page.content: { {LANDSCAPE/BUILDING:}Important for two reasons: was the seat of Williams family and it created the village of Miskin as part of the estate. House dates back to Elizabethan times. Gardens neglected but has some exotic trees. {FUNCTION:}Much land sold by Williams family. The House is converted into 14 flats because the family think it is too big for family use {FUTURE DEVELOPMENTS:}Sir Brandon Rhys Williams wishes to develop remaining land near M4 for industries and warehousing. Part of this area, now marginal farming land in the valley bottom, will be landscaped as a golf course, while the House may become a Country Club with a range of leisure and sports facilities.
